newsitem.title: USA: Cephalon to buy call options, issue stock.
newsitem.headline: Cephalon to buy call options, issue stock.

text.p: Cephalon Inc said Wednesday it arranged to purchase call options representing the right to acquire up to 2.5 million shares of its common stock, in order to benefit from any appreciation in the market value of its common stock.

To pay for the call options the company said it plans to issue up to 500,000 shares of the company's common stock, subject to the effectiveness of a registration statement which Cephalon has filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.
The company said in a statement it made the arrangement with a financial institution. It did not name the institution. No one at Cephalon was available for comment.

The call options to be purchased by the company would be acquired from the institution in one or more transactions, with the number of options and their purchase price, strike price, appreciation cap and other specific terms of the call options to be agreed upon at the time of each purchase.
Cephalon said it would receive in cash any excess of the fair market value of the stock over the strike price of the call options.
The options are expected to have a term of six months.
Cephalon is an international bio-phamaceutical company which develops products to treat neurological disorders.
